"Steak it is. What does Dennis want? xxx mom"

"Hang on"

Amy asked her brother what he wanted "I'm not that bothered. Got any steak and kidney pie? with fries as well." he answered. "Hopefully it'll all be ready when we get there." Amy she said, forgetting about her worries at the promise of steak.
She quickly texted their mother.

"Dennis wants steak and kidney pie with fries. He's like you apparently when it comes to food. What are you having?"

"I was actually planning on having the same thing. xxx mom"

"Mom really? But then I guess its a special occasion so."

"So I have your permission then honey? Just this once? xxx mom"

"Yeah just this once. Then I'm putting my foot down. Just cause you're big doesn't been you can hurt yourself. I can't lose you..."

"You'll never lose me honey. Mommy won't ever leave you alone in this world. Soon we'll all be together. xxx mom"

"Even dad?"

"Your father and I don't exactly get on. Especially after he refused money from me to take care of Dennis. Stupid prideful man xxx"

Amy was shocked at this. Did Dennis know about it? Could he have had a better life than the one she'd found him in?
She looked over at her brother and felt a surge of anger towards their father. How could he refuse the opportunity to give his son a better life. "Maybe in a way he's no better than mom. Dennis deserved better than what he got" Amy fumed inside. She received another text.

"Just so we're clear, do not tell your brother. At this stage he might think I'm trying to turn him against his father and I don't want him storming off if he thinks I'm lying. xxx mom"

"I won't. Would probably be better coming from you anyway, not that you could really make it sound better considering..."

"I know. Honestly I tried to send other things but they were always returned. I'm not trying to play down my part in all this, I should never have left your brother alone with him. I just wish your father could have put aside his problems with me. Maybe I should have tried to take custody of Dennis. xxx mom"

"You would have left dad all alone then. I want to ask you a lot of things when we get up there. I want you to promise you''ll be honest with me. Please?"

"I promise you can ask whatever you want and I will answer truthfully. I owe you both that much now. Looks like you're almost here. I'll get everything ready okay? xxx mom"

"Okay mom. love you"

"love you to. xxx mom"

Amy felt a massive weight lift from her chest. Her conversation with her mom had really put her at ease as it meant she wasn't focused on Miranda's massive size. She relaxed into her seat and looked out "Damn moms titty's are fucking epic. I want some like those."
Dennis gave her a dirty look and avoided looking in his mothers direction.
Miranda had a rather impressive g cup that currently dominated their current view outside. Amy was always a little jealous of her moms large breast size. Now that jealousy grew a little fiercer as she gawked at the colossal orbs of flesh. She'd seen the way they bounced as her mom walked, how people would stare at the tremendous rack of the giantess milf. "Now I'll never get to be a big boobed giantess" Amy sighed inwardly "No fair mom"

Amy looked over and noticed Karen giving her a knowing smile. She knew Amy was jealous of her mother.

They all jumped as a thundering voice boomed from above. the voice of God "I require one large rare steak with fries and one large steak and kidney pie with fries as well. I also want an extra large steak and kidney pie with extra fries. Oh and a bottle of red wine, pick which ever you think is best."

"For fucks sake woman" Amy groaned "When I said she could have the pie I meant a normal one."
"You said she could have one? Mom doesn't sound like the kind of person who gets told what to do." Dennis said.
Karen noted that this was the first time she'd heard him refer to Miranda as mom. She smiled "Maybe this won't be a complete disaster after all"

"Mom is going on a diet whether she likes it or not. I'm not losing her to something stupid like heart disease." Amy actually sounded serious. "I can't lose her, not when we all just got back together again" she teared up a little.
Karen held Amy's hand "Shush now. Nothings going to happen. What brought this on?"
"That" Amy pointed at her mother "we're getting together for the first time as a family and yet she's further away than ever now. I want my mom, not some God." Amy was full on crying at this point as Karen held her.
"She's still your mom. She wont leave you. She always calls you her angel. Maybe she just finds it difficult to show her feelings sometimes." Karen comforted her.

Dennis felt tears stinging his eyes as he watched his sister cry. He thought back to what his dad had said about their moms fear of being hurt. "I get that's why she was always so guarded." Deep down what Dennis really wanted, just like Amy, was his mom. "Don't fuck this up for us mom. I'll give you one chance and that's it." Dennis went and sat next to Amy and wrapped his arms around her. "I guess me and mom will have to try and start over." Dennis told his sister "we'll both have to try our best for you."

"I'm sure she will" Karen said. "She'd better" Dennis replied.

They were all shaken out of their emotional moment by a booming sound from below. It had a rhythm to it, like a tapping noise. They all looked down through the clear floor and could just make out below. Miranda's foot was bouncing up and down.

"She must be nervous" Karen said to Dennis "Can't blame her since it's been so long since she saw you. I know she really wants to make this work for all of you so please just give her this chance."
"You seem really loyal to someone who shrunk you down without a second thought" Dennis raised an eyebrow "she's your God now right?"
"She's all our God. And she's always done right by me."
"Uh huh. Maybe to you but right now all I see is my big momma." Dennis chuckled.
"Not much has changed, my house is still the same, I eat the same food. If anything she's kind of made everything better, we're all equal now." Karen shrugged.
"Equal beneath her you mean. I guess it could be someone worse, like someone who's just plain evil. Maybe having our mom be God won't be so bad after all."
"That's a good way to think of it."

"She's our big momma God" Amy giggled "just hope she remembers the mom part of it."

The car finally began to slow as it reached it's destination. The doors opened and for the first time in years Dennis came face to face, almost anyway, with his gigantic mother. He saw her through a large glass window as he stepped out onto a platform.. He gulped nervously and began following Karen down a corridor to where he'd properly meet his maker.
152131111.title: getting from foot to head

1521311111.content:
"Come on, not much further." Karen smiled back at Amy and Dennis as they walked. "You'll be able to see your mom and talk to her from where you'll be sitting."

"She won't be able to see us though..." Amy hung her head. She was still upset about the way things were right now "we're pretty much like ants to her."
"You are not an ant Amy, your mom knows you're right here with her" Karen assured her. "And we're more like microbes anyway" she thought.
"Mom is still pretty far away isn't she?" Dennis asked. "We'll yes, otherwise you would only see a wall of flesh. She's actually kilometers away from here."
"Kilometers? It's insane how big she is." Amy huffed and looked out the window at her mom.

Miranda wore a black dress that showed off her immense cleavage. Her long blond hair was pulled up into a bun and she wore dark red lipstick that contrasted against her tan skin.
Dennis looked into his moms large green eyes, they were just how he remembered them being "she's barely aged" he thought "I guess money can buy her the best stuff to keep young. Now she has all the money." Dennis noticed his mom was a little fidgety "I guess she is serious about this after all"
"I've never seen mom so nervous" Amy linked her arm with Dennis's as they walked "she looks like she might start hyper ventilating or something. Hang on, what if something did happen? she's so big how could anyone help her?"

"Don't worry. There are plenty of contingency's in place, nothing bad will happen." Karen looked back and smiled at the panicking teenager. "I'm trusted to take care of everything if your mom gets sick okay? She'll obviously have to shrink down while she gets better and I'll assume control until she does."
"You? Mom trusts you that much?" Dennis asked.
"Yes, I've been with your mom a long time. Like I said to you before she's always been good to me. I'm really glad she trusts me so much."
Amy piped up "When you say assume control, you mean like of everything?" "Yes. And that does include finances as well if you're wondering" "So you'd be..." "As big as your mom is now yes." Karen had a grin like a Cheshire cat.

Dennis watched the fit red head in front of him walk. He imagined Karen growing as large as his mom, with her hands on her shapely hips, smiling down at him. "Fuck, I wouldn't mind seeing her so huge." Dennis daydreamed until he felt a pain in his ribs and found Amy scowling at him. She knew what he'd been thinking about clearly, he smiled sheepishly and shrugged his shoulders.

"She's to old for you" Amy whispered "I can tell you think she's really hot but still."
"How old exactly?" he whispered back. Amy hissed "She's thirty two" "So what, I'm perfectly legal now anyway."
"Do you really think she'd go for you?" "You saying she thinks I'm ugly" "No of course not."

"What are you two whispering about back there" they heard and looked up at a smiling Karen. "We're here now, you should probably take off your shoes" she opened a door and led them into a large beautifully furnished room. There was a truly massive window which gave them a perfect view of their mothers face. The room had an ornate dining table and chairs beside the window, while through an open door on their left they saw a nice lounge. The carpet was soft and luxurious as they walked across it.

"This is where you can come and relax when you want to spend time with your mom while she's working out there" Karen explained and showed them around, inside the huge lounge was a large TV and other electronics. They could also see yet another door which led to a kitchen.
"All this is just for us?" Amy asked and smiled as she walked into the kitchen. "Yep" Karen affirmed and looked at Dennis "This is for you two alone, there's actually bedrooms for you both on the other side of the hallway. If you want them of course, we could always move you elsewhere in the palace."

Dennis eyed her suspiciously "You're quick to assume I'm moving here to live."
"No of course not. But when you are here you'll have your own place to stay away from everyone else." Karen almost fumbled her words.
"Mom isn't trying to buy me is she? Because so far money has been the cause of all our family's problems." Dennis was just toying with Karen at the moment, he was actually starting to like her. She obviously cared for Amy a lot and seemed to care about his mom to. "She must be really loyal to mom if she's entrusted with all that power."

"No, your mother would never attempt to buy your love. She knows how important this is to you both and.... and..." Karen noticed Dennis trying and failing to keep a straight face. "You're teasing me aren't you?"
"A little. You're cute when you're all flustered like that" Dennis laughed.
"Oh, well thank you Dennis. I'm not sure what you're mother would think though." Karen calmed herself and smiled at Dennis
"You're a little cute yourself. Especially when you were all brooding and pouting on the way up"
This caught Dennis off guard and he stammered "I... wa.. was not pouting. I just..."
"You kinda were" he heard Amy from the kitchen "tryina act all aloof as if you didn't care about seeing mom."
"I was not. I'm still not sure I should do this" Dennis huffed and then was startled when Karen took his hand "You'll do fine. I think you really want this as badly as she does." she said "I know you didn't want to come originally but you want to see her don't you?"

"I... yes. I just want my mom back" he squeezed her hand a little and she smiled again. "Well there she is" Karen pointed out the window "You've both been waiting for this a long time. So lets get started shall we?"
"Uh how exactly? I know Amy was texting her but its a bit impersonal" Dennis watched curiously as Karen went over to a panel on the wall and began pressing on a touch screen.

She proceeded to speak "They're here." Dennis was a bit confused until he heard a voice, his mothers voice, she sounded normal, like she was in the room with them.
"Thank you Karen. Could you please go check on dinner for us?" his mom said. Amy walked back into the room.
"Of course. I'll leave you three alone for some family bonding then. See you later guys" Karen began walking back to the door and noticed both teenagers looked a bit anxious.
"You'll do fine" she told them and hugged Amy then Dennis.
Dennis didn't resist Karen as she hugged him and watched her leave. He couldn't stop himself from admiring hips as they swayed. He was broken out of his trance

"So was the trip okay?" he heard his mom say. "Uh can you actually hear us mom?" Amy looked around trying to find any microphones on the wall. "Yes honey I can hear you just fine."
"Oh cool, I was worried we'd end up deaf if we heard your "normal" current speaking voice" Amy joked. Hearing her moms voice at a normal volume was putting her at ease. "And yeah the trip was okay. But like I texted you I'm not going back on that thing. I'll have to parachute down if necessary."
"You will do no such thing" Miranda gasped "I promise I'll find a better way, Just be patient alright? Now, um, is your brother there?"
"I'm here... mom" Dennis breathed deeply trying to stay cool. Part of him wanted to explode at her but he also wanted her to just be there with him.

His moms voice came over the speakers "AreYouOkayHowAreYouFeelingAreYouHealthy," Dennis and Amy stood there shocked at the garbled speech coming into the room.
"Mom I'm fine, calm down." Dennis smiled and thought "she does care about me then." He felt, good. The fact his mom sounded genuinely concerned about his well being filled him with warmth.
"You okay mom?" he asked her while looking out the window at her face "You look stressed" She actually looked like she was about to burst into tears. He watched her regain her composure.

"I'm fine thank you. So are you sure you're okay? I know getting here must have been a bit annoying. I'll make sure it doesn't happen next time." she said. "Next time?" Dennis asked. "Well if that's what you want of course. I really hope you'll want to come back again. I missed you, I'm so grateful you came, even though it must have been hard. I... hope you don't hate me, I love you so much."

Dennis could hear his mom barely keeping it together "She sounds so desperate. Maybe she has changed from the cold uncaring mom I remember." Dennis spoke "I don't hate you mom, I used to think I did, but..." his voice started to crack and he began crying "I just wanted my mom, why did you leave me? why wasn't I enough for you? I needed you all this time and you were off being a giant, and I was left small enough for you to step on and not even notice." Tears streamed down Dennis's face as he broke down "I just want you to love me mom". Amy wrapped her arms around her brother in an effort to calm him.

Miranda sat there and couldn't speak. Listening to her little boy cry out for her broke her heart. She finally lost control and began sobbing uncontrollably "I'm so sorry baby, I'm sorry I left you. I do love you and I'll never leave you again I promise. I'll spend the rest of our lives making it up to you no matter what."

After years of trying to protect herself from any pain, after always being afraid of getting hurt if she opened up to anyone. The cold prison around Miranda's finally heart shattered. From now on she'd take care of her children no matter what.
1521311111.title: Family reunion

15213111111.content:
Miranda felt as though decades of repressed pain and emotion were pouring from her eyes. "I'll take care of you from now on" she managed to say between sobs "if you'll let me. Please let me."

Amy rubbed her brothers back as he cried "He's been holding this in all this time." she looked at her equally distraught mother "I guess she has to. Maybe its good that they're letting this all out. Hopefully it'll make things easier in the future."
"You know this is good for you both" Amy said out loud "you needed this."

"You think" Dennis managed to say. Right now his face hurt like hell from all the crying he was doing.
"Yup, better to get this out in the open right away so you know where you stand. Right mom?" Amy patted him on the head.
"Yes, it's certainly better. I feel a little lighter, like somethings been freed inside me." he heard through the speaker.
Dennis looked out to see his moms all eyes all puffy and red. Her makeup was running down her face, he'd never see her show so much emotion before. He didn't even know she was capable of such a display.
Dennis was feeling genuine sympathy for his mom, he was still angry and hadn't forgiven her yet, but he thought understood her a little better now. "I still wonder what the fuck led to her being like this."

Miranda looked towards the tiny, to her, room she knew contained her children. She couldn't see them with the her naked eye "something that'll have to be worked on" she thought and started trying to clean herself up. She doubted her children wanted to share dinner with her when she looked the way she did.
Miranda felt a buzz in her ear. A text from Karen

"Feel better?" Karen had clearly heard everything.

Miranda hoped it was only Karen that had heard it all. She texted back with the new implant in her head

"Yeah actually. I can't believe how much I was holding back. Please tell me you were the only one who heard all that"

"Don't worry I made sure everything was muted outside these walls. It's just you and them."

"Thank you Karen. I don't know what I'd do without you. I'm so grateful to you for everything you've done for us and for supporting me in this plan."

"I trust you more than anyone else. I knew it would be better if it was you who did something like this instead of some psycho.
This was bound to happen one day, you just beat everyone else to the punch."

"Thank you darling. Do you think Dennis will stay? Does he seem healthy?"

"He seems very healthy and I think as long as you take it slow and don't push him to hard he'll happily stick around. He clearly wants you in his life, although I don't think even he realized just how badly he did. He's also very cute as well if you must know. Caught him eyeing me up and down."

"I'll let him set the pace we go at. Also, cute?"

"Yep, he even called me cute to. Maybe he has a thing for older girls?"

"Well at least I know you'd never hurt him if you know...."

"Miranda are you trying to hook me up with your son?"

"No, no. I'm just saying if it was you I'd be glad he's in good hands."

"I'll keep that in mind. For now I'll just watch and see what he does. Also dinner is about ready, should I send everything in or do you need more time?"

"I'm fine now thank you. Send it on in. xxx"

Karen put her phone away and headed to the kitchen. She'd meant it when she said it was good Miranda had been the one to do this. Potentially becoming that big herself didn't hurt matters either "I bet that's what Dennis was thinking about" she giggled to herself. "He is pretty cute, maybe once he's settled in I'll make a move on him. Being the son of God will get him lots of attention so I'd better make him mine before anyone else does."

Dennis was in the bathroom cleaning himself up. The cold water felt good on his sore face, his muscles ached from the crying he'd engaged in. "Fuck I never want that again. Its never hurt that much before." He had cried a lot growing up when thinking about his mom and now he was with her again "I hope she means all the stuff she says."
He made sure he peed before going back into the dining room, he hadn't been since this morning. "Glad that elevator thing didn't take five hours. Doubt Amy and Karen would have liked it if I pissed on the floor." Dennis thought about Karen, he had been so focused on being moody that he hadn't taken in how pretty she was on the way up. Karen clearly worked out he could tell, he liked her long red hair and blue eyes. He definitely liked her hips and ass.
"Maybe I should try. She called me cute, I think she's hot. In a way she might be the second most powerful person in the world." That turned Dennis on a lot.

"Hey bro you done?" Amy banged on the door "Karen's back and she brought food." Amy heard frantic movement in the bathroom, the door flew open and Dennis rushed past her. Amy rolled her eyes and watched her brother collide with the door to the dining room. "Fucking hell. He wants to bang her doesn't he."

Karen watched Dennis tumble through the doorway and onto the floor. She walked over and crouched down beside him "you okay there? I don't want to have to tell your mom you had an accident your first day back together."
"I'm fine" Dennis gasped and rolled onto his back to find Karen's smiling face above him.
Karen took his hand and pulled him to his feet. "She's fucking strong" he thought. Dennis noticed a group of wait staff bringing food into the room "Smells good. Thanks" he waved awkwardly. He wasn't used to this kind of thing.

"A pleasure" a portly looking man said and smiled "If you need anything else just give us a call."
Karen noticed Dennis's awkwardness "Relax, you'll get used to it. You'll have to now you're the son of God."
"I, its weird when you do that. I mean God really?" Dennis sighed, causing Karen to laugh "I know to you she's just your really big mom. But to there rest of the world now..."
"Uh, huh. Still weird. Still if she hadn't done all this and shrunk us all I might not have met you." Dennis realized what he'd just said and blushed earning another laugh from Karen.
"I'll see you later Dennis. Have a good time Amy." Karen left the two siblings alone to eat.

"Well that was painful" Amy shook her head and sat down "still, I actually think she was admiring you."
"YouThinkIHaveAChance?" he blurted out "I mean, do think she really likes me?"
Amy snort laughed and began to eat. Dennis soon joined her.

Miranda had heard the conversation inside the room but chose to keep quiet about it. She cleared her throat "Did the food arrive okay kids? I hope its what you wanted."
"Its good mom" Amy said with a mouthful of steak "you okay now?"
"I'm fine thank you angel. Dennis are you enjoying it?"
Dennis was a little distracted, this was the best food he'd ever tasted. "I think he's a bit preoccupied with his pie right now, looks like he's gonna drool everywhere" Amy said "or maybe he's thinking about Karen."
This snapped Dennis out of his daze "I was not. Its just this is the best thing I've ever eaten"
"I'm glad you like it honey. Amy don't tease your brother. Although you can hardly blame him if he was thinking about her." Miranda laughed.

"Mom! I was not." Dennis yelled. "Well I know she thinks you're cute so..." Miranda said "I guess if you want to see her again you'll have to come back." Miranda froze a little, she hoped she hadn't pushed things to far, not as this delicate stage.
Dennis could see the small amount of fear on her face and decided to put her at ease "Hm, I guess I could stick around here and check things out." "You mean check Karen out." "Not what I meant Amy. I just want this to work mom."
"I want this to work as well honey. I'll do whatever it takes." his mom was starting to sound more relaxed now.
"I haven't exactly forgiven you yet... but I promise I'll try if you do." Dennis looked out at her.
"I will try Dennis and hopefully one day you can forgive me. I'll never stop loving you and I'll try be the mom you want me to be." Miranda breathed a sigh of relief that she hadn't screwed things up already "I know you must have a lot of questions so you can ask me anything you want"
15213111111.title: Heart to heart

choices: No, she was God and hadto stay that way
152131111111.content:
"You promise to answer them?" Dennis asked "Yes, I promise" his mom responded.

"Did you ever think about me? Did you ever wonder if I was okay?" Dennis felt emotion well up in him again but this time he didn't cry.
"I thought about you all the time. I always wondered what you looked like, if you were happy with your father." Miranda told him.
"If you thought about me, you could have reached out. Just so I could know you loved me and missed me. Was that to much for you?" Dennis kept his composure in spite of the pain and anger he felt. He wanted to scream at her but knew she was trying her best, so he would to.

"I... did want to... but... but I couldn't" Miranda really didn't want to tell him at this stage about the things she'd tried to send him. Amy knew what her wanted to say but also knew she was scared of upsetting Dennis anymore than he already was.
Amy texted her

"Mom just tell him. If you lie to him it'll make things worse, you promised to tell him anything he wanted."

"I know but he's been hurt enough already. I can't do that to him." came the response.

"The longer you wait the worse it'll get. I'll make sure he doesn't storm off when you tell him. I'm sure he'll appreciate your honesty no matter how angry he gets"

"Do you really think I should?"

"Yes mom. TELL HIM!!!"

"Mom? Tell me why you couldn't contact me?" Dennis demanded. He looked out and saw her fighting back tears.
"What could be so bad?" he thought "It must be something horrible if she's struggling to tell me."

"Dennis I... I couldn't contact you because your father wouldn't let me." his mom finally confessed as her voice cracked.

Dennis sat their stunned. He felt like his whole world was collapsing around him. His dad had lied to him? All these years he'd lied?

"What do you mean he wouldn't let you?" Dennis demanded angrily. he was gripping the table so hard his knuckles had turned white. "Is this some sort of way to shift the blame onto dad. If that's what you're doing you will never ever see me again."

"I promised I'd tell you the truth. I have no reason to lie. It would be stupid to jeopardize my relationship with you when we've just come back together." his mom cried.

Dennis knew she had a point. There was no reason to risk this whole thing over a lie like that. She must know how it would drive him away if it was. Dennis let go of the table and asked her again "Why wouldn't he let you mom"

"You're father and I ended things on a bad note. Things got even worse when he..." his mom stuttered again.
"Come on mom, I just need the truth okay?" Dennis tried to sound calm.
"Okay. Once I was settled into my new life with the man I married, I tried to send money to your father so he could use it for you" his mom was visibly shaking he noticed "Your father though, refused to take it and said he didn't need anything from me. Even though it meant you'd have a better life it seemed his hatred of me blinded him to it."

Miranda was trying to fight back the tears as she looked in the direction of her children. She wished she could hold Dennis right now but he was so tiny and she was so massive. She was a god compared to them right now. "And only God gets to be big" she told herself.

"I could have had a better life?" Dennis sank into his chair. If it was true then he'd basically grown up in near squalor because his dad wanted to spite his mom. "Why would he do that to me? How could he do that to me?" he thought about all the years he'd cried in bed, thinking his mom wanted nothing to do with him. His dad had always told him that mom was a complicated woman and that she did love him in her own way. "Was that some sort of sick joke at my expense?"

"Did you just give up after he refused?" he asked the gigantic woman he watched from afar.
"No, over the years I sent other things. they all got returned. Even just letters I wrote you. I should have tried harder I know, I should never have left you alone with him." his mom actually looked angry now.

"She's really angry about being kept from me. But why didn't she just come and see me? She obviously wasn't as big as she is now back then but I saw pictures in magazines. There's no way he could have stopped her coming." Dennis was as confused as he was angry.

He vocalized his questions "Why didn't you come see me? You must have been big enough that he couldn't stop you"
"I was scared something would happen.That he would just disappear with you and I'd lose my chance at seeing you again. How could I risk that? It's why I didn't tell Amy where you were until now if I had she would have gone stomping in there to retrieve you." Miranda breathed deeply.
Amy heard this and finally understood her mother. "She's right" Amy said quietly "If she'd told me about all this I would have flattened the place looking for you."

"You think dad would have hurt me if you hadn't backed down?" Dennis hated to ask this but he needed to know.
"No, never in a million years would I think that. Whatever our problems, I at least believe he thought he was protecting you." his mom said, which made him relieved.

"How was keeping my mom from me protecting me? He knew how I felt, how much I wanted you there. He lied to me for years just so he could get back at you" Dennis was tearing up again "He knew I needed you and he didn't care"
"He probably thought I'd sue him for sole custody if he ever let me take you out of his sight" his mom followed up "and... he was right in that regard. I wouldn't have let you back in that place if I had you. If he hadn't been so stubborn.... Its not like I would have forced him out of your life."
"You wouldn't have?"
"No I wouldn't have, I was always willing to put aside our problems for you two. I know I've always had issue's showing affection to you both but I've also always loved you and wanted what was best." Miranda hoped Dennis believed her, she couldn't lie to him, not now.

"Stupid selfish old bastard" Amy screamed and smashed a plate against the wall "He knew he was partially responsible for keeping us apart and he lied to my face. I never want to see him again." she stormed out into the kitchen and slammed the door.

"Amy, Amy, angel come on." Miranda begged her daughter. The window stretched across the entirety of the apartment so she knew Amy could still see her. "Amy look at me. I know you're angry, but you can almost understand his perspective can't you?" She had no idea if Amy actually was looking at her but she got the feeling she was.

"I don't give a fuck about his perspective, he's just as responsible as you, if not more so for us all being apart. I hate him." Amy screamed.

Miranda decided to text Karen

"Karen could you please go in there and help calm Amy down? I assume you've heard things?"

"Yeah I heard everything. I could go right in but..."

"What? you have a better idea? please I could really use any help you have right now"

"Maybe you could go in there for a while."

"What how could I go in there?"

"You could transfer all your assets to me for a while and shrink down to be with your kids. I'll take care of things up there while you be the mom they need down here."

"I'm not sure about that idea"

"You trust me don't you? You know I'm capable of running things in your absence. Everything will fine in my hands I promise. I've never let you down before right?"

"I guess I could for a little while. But it's such a big responsibility, are you ready for that?"

"I'm ready and waiting, you trained me for this remember? and if you let me I'll be more than big enough to handle the responsibility. I'm suggesting this because I care about all of you, you're... you're my family to okay?"

Miranda was uncertain of what to do. She trusted Karen more than anyone else and knew she could handle it.
But if something went wrong she didn't want to put that on her. "I don't want her getting hurt. She's right though, she's part of this family" Miranda wrestled with the idea and finally decided...
152131111111.title: continued

1521311111111.content:
Karen held her breath as she waited for a response, she honestly expect Miranda to agree to it, not so soon anyway. Her phone beeped.

"You're right. I need to be with them right now, truly be with them. I need to show them how much I love them. If they found out I refused your offer there's no telling how much damage it could cause. So get ready."

Karen was actually gobsmacked "She agreed, I can't believe she agreed. She truly loves them then if she's going to shrink down and..." Karen was giddy "I'm gonna be big, I'm gonna be the biggest person in the world. I'm gonna be so fucking massive."

"I'll get right on it but first I want to see them before I do. I won't spoil the surprise though don't worry." she texted.

"Thank you, really, for everything. I bet they'll be so shocked when I walk through that door. And of course when they see you large and in charge outside."

"You'll still be the one in charge. I'll just keep your seat warm with my soon to be monolithic booty. xxx"

"Ha ha. See you soon. xxx"

Karen skipped towards the siblings apartment "Gonna be so big, big big big" she giggled. Karen had a surprise for Dennis before she grew, she wanted to give it to him sooner rather than later.
She entered the apartment and spotted Dennis by the kitchen door. He was trying to convince his sister to come out but wasn't having much luck.

Dennis turned around as he heard Karen enter and smiled "she's really pissed off in there. You know her better than me so maybe you can convince her."
"I can't stay I'm afraid, I've got some big things to take care of. I wanted to give you this before I left." Karen held out a wrapped present to him.
"I, what is this?" he asked and took the present. "Open it and you'll find out. I felt it was necessary if you were sticking around." Karen waved him on.
Dennis began unwrapping it and found a brand new cell phone "This is... I've never had my own before. I couldn't exactly, you know... " Dennis felt embarrassed "Thank you Karen, I'm really grateful for his."
"Don't worry about it. I wasn't your fault you didn't have these things" "Tell me about it." "Well you need to stay in touch with everyone right?" Karen emphasized everyone, making it obvious she meant her as well. She threw her arms around Dennis then kissed him on the cheek.

Dennis went red "I tha... thank you" he stammered "I hope I see you again soon, I mean whenever you're around."
"Oh I'm sure you'll see me again real soon" Karen grinned and turned to leave before she heard "Wait where's mom going?"

Dennis watched his mother stand and exit through a large door. "Why, why is she leaving? seriously, of all the times she could have left.."
Karen moved to comfort the upset Dennis "Don't worry she won't be long I'm sure. Probably needs a bathroom break and she'll be right back."
"Oh, okay. I hope she does come back. Amy needs her." Dennis looked towards the kitchen.
"Well I'll see you later and don't fret, everything will be fine soon I promise." Karen left and Dennis sighed deeply. "Hurry back mom."

Karen ran down the corridor to a nearby elevator car and jumped in. She wanted to change her outfit first before she grew, she wanted Dennis to admire her body as she towered over him. "I'm gonna make you mine cutey."

Miranda waited nervously in the chamber where she'd swap sizes with Karen "come on girl what's taking so long. Don't tell me you got cold feet."
She felt a phone call in to her implants and answered "I'm all ready to go big momma" came Karen's cheery voice "I wish I could see the looks on their faces when you go in and when they see big o'l me."
"I'll try and record their reactions for you. I was worried for a moment you'd backed out" Miranda breathed a sigh of relief.
"Hell no, I wouldn't do that to you three. Now lets get this party started, you ready to link up?"
"I'm ready, have fun up here." Miranda opened up the link between her and Karen. They both had unique implants that could only link with each other.

Karen saw the numbers on the screen in her head as the transfer began "Here we go." She felt her body begin to grow and climb towards the ceiling. Her body grew quickly and she could soon see Miranda's face as she shrank towards her. They both smiled at each other as they passed "Going up" Karen laughed. "Up and up" Miranda chuckled and continued dwindling "You're looking sexy. There any particular reason? Say a cute young man you want to notice you?" "Maybe, I guess we'll see if it works" "I don't doubt it will."

Karen watched Miranda become smaller and smaller. She felt so powerful "So big" she thought. She was wearing a black tank top and sheer grey yoga pants that barely stretched over her beautiful curves. Karen ran her hands over her wide hips and just kept growing. "Fuck I'm such a sexy giantess" Finally she felt her growth stop and let out a booming laugh "Oh ho ho ho." and loved how powerful her voice sounded.

Miranda was feeling a little intimidated by how massive Karen was to her now. She couldn't see past Karen's toes. She gulped nervously "I guess for now she's God then."
"You okay down there?" Karen's godlike voice came from above. Miranda called her phone "You couldn't use your phone?" "Sorry, couldn't help it. This is awesome, I can't even see you down there."
Miranda laughed "We'll I hope you have fun playing God for a while. If all goes well I might have to ask you again in the future."
"Sure, anytime you want to be with them just ask okay? Now off you go, I'm really glad you're doing this for them. Let me know when you've settled in so I can make my big entrance. Love you." Karen boomed.

"I will. Love you to" Miranda hung up and began her journey towards her waiting children.

Karen waited until Miranda left the chamber and then muted any potential sound going out. "Fuck I'm so huge" she boomed. She knew no one was listening so decided to play around "Mwha ha ha ha. Bow before me mortals" she placed her hands on her hips and imagined a mass of people at her feet "bow before your all powerful goddess, worship my sexy curves. I own you all and you will obey me, if you do not.." she raised her leg and lowered her foot onto the imaginary crowd. "That's what happens to those who defy their goddess. Mm their massive, huge, gigantic, titanic, sexy giantess goddess." Karen began crouching down and imagined another crowd cowering beneath her huge bubble butt "fear me insects" she lowered her ass and sat down upon them, then wiggled her hips from side to side. "Suffer beneath my glorious cheeks puny mortals. Suffer beneath Karen, the one true goddess."
Karen was having the time of her life "Wonder if Miranda would ever let me do this for real? I could crush murderer's and rapists under my ass, no one would miss them. I'll have to ask."

Miranda meanwhile was becoming increasingly anxious as she approached the apartment "Its fine, you'll be fine and they'll be fine." she told herself. She stood outside the door and slowed her breathing. She decided maybe she should ring the bell instead of just walking in. Karen turned on the recording implants in her eyes and pressed the buzzer.

Dennis heard the bell ring "Who the fuck could that be?" If it was Karen she'd have come straight in. He really didn't want some stranger in here right now. Dennis cautiously walked over and opened the door. His mouth fell open as he came face to face with his mother. Well, almost. She still towered over him at seven feet tall but she was there, right in front of him. He tried to fight back the tears he could feel welling up inside him but couldn't manage it.
"Mommy" he flung his arms around her then felt her do the same. "I know baby. I'm here now, I'm so sorry. This is how it should have been from the start instead of me all the way out there." Miranda felt the tears running down her face as she held her eldest child "You're my precious boy Dennis. I'll never leave you again."
Dennis pulled away and looked up into his moms emerald eyes. They were just like his "Mom when did you....? That's where you went. Karen knew you were coming didn't she?"
"Yes. I wanted to surprise you, I needed to prove to you how much I love you and Amy. I need to be your mom right now, not some distant God." Miranda beamed down at him "he looks so much like me" she thought then said "You're so handsome honey. I can see why Karen likes you."

"Mom! I... does she really like me?" Dennis was definitely interested in Karen and if she was interested in him then...
"I'd say she does. But now, where's your sister?"
"Still in the kitchen. Pretty sure she's trashed the place by now. Sorry mom" Dennis sighed "If I hadn't brought up those thin..."
"No. None of that was your fault. Maybe I should have been more careful with what I told you so soon." Miranda hugged him again.

Miranda then approached the kitchen door and called "Amy, open up. I want to talk with you." "Go away I'm not talking to anyone." came the response, followed by a crash. "Amy please stop smashing up your own home. Just come out and we can talk about this." "No."
Miranda shook her head, then she had an idea "Amy, just do one thing for me. Look out the window."
"Why the fuck would I want to look at you right now?" Amy screamed. "Just a quick peep. You'll like what you'll see."
"Fine, I'll fucki... Where the hell are you?" "Open the door Amy" Miranda begged.

"Wait are you?" Amy scrambled towards the kitchen door and flung it open. In front of her she saw her mother, she couldn't remember the last time she was so close in height to her. Amy flew into her mothers arms. "I can't believe you're here" "I am though."

Dennis smiled as he watched them hug then said "Hang on? Mom if you're small then who has your money?"
"Yeah where'd it all go?" Amy asked.
"Well she wanted to surprise you two so.." Miranda smiled at them.
1521311111111.title: Karen goes big.

15213111111111.content:
Miranda texted Karen, who was still playing around with her new size in the other room.

"Karen I think its time you presented yourself. I'm sure these two will be happy to see you"

"Okay then here I come. I'll make sure they remember this" Karen replied.

Miranda smiled at her children, she wasn't quite sure what Karen planned but she wasn't concerned.She trusted Karen completely "Alright you two here she comes"

Clearly I didn't matter enough to anyone to be worth telling about your precious fucking plan, so why the fuck should any of this matter to me." Amy had tears running down her face.

Karen tried to calm her "I know. It was unacceptable that you weren't told and I'm sorry."
"No fuck that. You all knew and couldn't be bothered so its to little to fucking late. I wasn't included in any of this so maybe I don't belong here. Obviously no one will notice if I'm not here so fuck this place and fuck all of you." Amy screamed and ran out of the room.

Dennis ran after his sister "Fuck my life."
152131111111111111111111.title: Future Tech

1521311111111111111111111.content:
Amy stormed towards the large drone she'd met earlier. Her eyes were red and her throat ached from crying but she ignored it, she was going to teach them all what she thought of their wonderful palace and its contents.

She waved her bracelet in front of the drones face and hoped it would work "Hey wake up. Will you obey me?" The drone whirred as it turned towards her "I'll take that as a yes then." Amy spotted something in another part of the room. Two more dormant drones. She had a malicious gleam in her eyes as she ran over and demanded they activate. Lights flickered in the machines eyes and they stood up, awaiting her instructions. "Show time." Amy smirked.

Dennis legged it down the corridor to the room where they'd originally entered. He'd just about reached the door when he heard an enormous crash and screeching metal "Fuck." he yelled and went inside. "Amy what the fuck did you do." Dennis was staring, staring at a massive hole in the far wall of the room and Amy was nowhere to be seen.
"Shit, shit, shit." Dennis muttered and ran over to the hole. He could see that the drone Amy was using had torn its way through multiple rooms and various people who worked here wondering what the fuck had just happened. Dennis entered the newly created passage and followed his sisters path of destruction.

He could still hear the machine ahead breaking through even more of the lab as it went and stopped briefly to ask someone what they'd seen.
"Did you see a blond girl just pass through here?"
A young dark skinned man nodded and pointed down the tunnel "Yeah, she had three of those fucking drones and everything. The fuck is going on in there?"
"Three? Shit. Um thanks for the info, don't worry I'll stop her." Dennis gave an awkward smile and ran after Amy.
"Who is she anyway?" The young scientist yelled after him. Dennis shouted over his shoulder "My younger sister. She's pissed our mom didn't tell what was going on here." "Who's your mom?" "The really big lady upstairs."

The young scientist stood speechless at what he'd just learned. That was Gods daughter and she was on a rampage cause she was mad.

Dennis followed the sounds of twisting metal, he was catching up now, "Fuck sake Amy." he swore and rounded a corner.
In the distance he saw them, three large machines tearing their way through one wall after another. Behind and below them he spotted his sister "Amy stop" he yelled and continued running.

Amy heard her brothers voice and turned around "Fuck that" she yelled "I'm teaching them a lesson. They didn't care about me so I won't care about them. I'll rip this whole place apart if I have to, then maybe they'll get what it feels like to have someone not give a fuck about their feelings to."
She turned away from him and resumed moving forwards. She didn't know where the hell she was going and quite frankly she didn't care. Amy just wanted to cause as much destruction as possible. She had no intention of harming anyone she came across just the building.

Dennis managed to catch up with his sister and grabbed her shoulder "Amy come on. Don't do this to yourself, it'll just make you feel worse."
"Fuck off. I'm sick of being ignored by them, being treated as an afterthought in their lives." Amy screamed at him.
"I'm not ignoring you am I? I get how you feel, it hurts I know..." Dennis was interrupted before he could finish.
"No you don't know. I know you didn't see mom for so long but at least you had dad around. You felt abandoned by her but you never had to experience it all up close, I was right here and I was still ignored, brushed aside all the time." Amy cried "At least you actually had one our parents in your life, at least dad was actually there for you. I had no one."

"What about your friends? You had them, I don't have any. I won't throw the money thing in your face, I get it didn't make up for mom not being there and you're right I had dad. I guess I can't fault him entirely for what happened. If I had been with you and mom maybe I would have experienced the same thing as you." Dennis was desperate to stop this before it went any further. "Neither of us knew what was going happen yesterday so you aren't on your own there."

"I get why you didn't know about this but I was around, they could have told me at anytime but they couldn't even be bothered with that. They just left me outside knowing what was planned, what if I'd been in one of those places mom crushed? How long would have taken them to notice I was missing?" Amy buried her face in her brothers shoulder "Would they even care if I was dead?"

Dennis held his sister and rocked her back and forth "Its okay now. I care about you, I'll never leave you I promise. Do you really believe no one cares about you?" He put his hand under and lifted it.

Amy's makeup was smeared down her face. Her brother used his sleeve to wipe it away and looked her in the eye "What about the home that was made for you and me? They clearly thought about you then, making sure you had a place to live inside this place. And yeah I get material things aren't the be all and end all but it had all that effort put into it. Hell it has a view into moms office so she can talk to us right there."

"So? Its not like she can see if we're there or not. We're basically microbes to her, maybe she doesn't care like we thought and would just crush us and move on as if nothing happened." Amy wasn't sure if she believed that "She thinks she's a god now so why would us pathetic mortals even matter anymore?"
"After everything you think she might do that? Crush us. She shrank down to be with us last night, she did it because you were upset remember?" Dennis reminded her.
"Only because Karen brought it up, I doubt she would have considered it otherwise." Amy hit back "At least Karen takes an interest in me sometimes but even she didn't bother to explain anything."

Amy looked towards the drones she controlled "If I break this place they'll understand what it means to be trampled on, for someone to not give a fuck about what they feel, to not give any consideration for what they want. All I wanted was moms love and she was more interested in all of this, so I'll take what she wanted just like she took what I needed."

Amy started forward again but Dennis held her in place "No. What about all the people who could live here? You want to steal their chances at a better life just you're angry? Forget about mom for a moment and think about all the family's who had nothing, this place could give them everything. Your friends are coming here. You want the first thing they see to be a war zone?"

Amy sank to here knees. She knew her brother was right "I just... I'm sick of playing second fiddle to moms plans. I don't want to hurt anyone, I'm just tired of being hurt myself." She sobbed as Dennis knelt beside her.
"I know it hurts. It'll get better, that old life is gone now and we can start over, together. And I'd like to meet your friends, would be nice to meet some people my age." Dennis rubbed her back as she vented the last of her anger. "Come on lets go back."

Amy waved around her "What about this. I broke so much stuff"
Dennis looked at the drones Amy had controlled and pointed at them "We use those duh. Order them to repair everything they damaged."
Amy nodded and wobbled her way to her feet "Alright. Start repairing all the damage you caused."

The drones whirred into action and began fixing the walls in front of them.
Dennis patted Amy on the back "See, it'll all be fixed in no time. Besides this will be a great field test for them."
Amy laughed "Yeah but I doubt anyone else will see it that way."
"I'll deal with that, I won't let anyone cause any more drama. I think there's been enough for one day." he assured her.

"Amy! Dennis!"
The siblings looked up and saw Karen walking towards them. Dennis waved to her and she ran the rest of the way.
"Oh god are you two okay." she flung her arms around them and cried "I'm so sorry Amy, we should never have left you in the dark like that."
"Its okay Karen and... I'm sorry I wrecked the building." Amy sniffled "I can fix it with the drones."
Karen looked up at the machines as they worked "Fuck the building. You're what matters to me right now okay." She chuckled "You did a pretty good job of controlling them, maybe you could work with them again sometime."

Amy snort laughed "Would anyone want me anywhere near this place or them again. It was kinda fun using them, I'm sorry I did all this."
Karen had a look of concern on her face when she realized where they were "Thank fuck you stopped here."
Dennis looked around confused "Why? where are we?"
Karen looked him in the eye and explained "There's a lab on the other side of the wall the drones would have gone though. Its where they've been conducting experiments for weather control. If you had broken through, if one of the devices had gone off, you might have been killed."

Amy went wide eyed, she could have gotten her and Dennis killed...
Karen continued speaking "we've already had one accident. They were trying to create a small storm but it started picking up more water than it should have. If they hadn't stopped it, it would have turned into a hurricane."
Dennis wondered what was so bad if they stopped it and asked "But it didn't so..."
Karen shook her head "The lead scientist on the project, Doctor Morse, sacrificed himself to disable the machine... He saved everyone."

Amy knew Doctor Morse "He's dead?" Karen nodded.
"Maybe we should get out of the way" Dennis jabbed towards the drones as they drew closer. They were repairing things incredibly quickly.

"Yeah, lets go. I think I owe all those people an apology" Amy said and began walking down the tunnel.
1521311111111111111111111.title: Mechanised Mayhem

15213111111111111111111111.content:
Amy felt shame as she stood in front of Doctor Beckett and the other assembled scientists. She took a deep breath and began apologizing to everyone.

"I'm really sorry for destroying so much of your labs. I shouldn't have taken my anger out on people who didn't deserve it, you've all worked so hard and I'm sorry I jeopardized your work here." Amy made eye contact with Doctor Beckett.

He walked forward and put his hand on her shoulder "Its okay Amy. From what I heard you say, no wonder you were angry. You had every right to be considering you were kept in the dark, it must have been terrifying to not know what was going on. Besides, the drones actually avoided damaging anything major so nothing has been lost."

Amy was shocked and stammered "But I... I almost got everyone killed."
"The drones are programmed to stop if they are actually putting anyone in danger. They wouldn't have destroyed something they knew would harm us." Charlie, the doctors assistant, said.
Amy felt a huge weight lift off her chest "Still, I shouldn't have done that."

Octavia was the next to speak up "I'm amazed you could control them so well. Especially as you'd never seen them before today, you're a natural at guiding them in their tasks."
Doctor Beckett smiled "Well I have an idea on how you could make it up to us. Would you be willing to help us with our research?"
"How could I help? I'm not really qualified for anything here." Amy was confused at first then realized what they meant "You want me to control the drones for you?"
"Yes. Having you direct them will help us immensely. I still don't know how you got them to respond so well." Octavia said excitedly.

Now Amy was even more confused "But all I did was wave my bracelet at them and they did as they were told. Not like I did anything special."

Doctor Beckett wondered what it could be that allowed Amy to direct them as well as she did "Interesting, those bracelets send and receive signals, it could be that the bracelet itself is responding to you in someway and from there connecting with the machines."
"The bracelets are connected to your physiology, your brain, its scanning you constantly." Charlie said "You might be influencing things subconsciously, making it and the machines an extension of yourself."

"Huh?" Amy had no clue what they were talking about.
Dennis moved beside her "They're saying its like you're manipulating the robots like an extra limb. Right?"
"In a sense yes but its like she doesn't need to make a conscious effort to actually move them like you would your arm or legs." Doctor Beckett tapped Amy's bracelet "What makes you different I wonder. So will you help me? Help us?"

Amy smiled, if this was a way to make things up to them then she'd do it. "Yes, I want to help you. That and controlling robots is really fun so."
"Glad to hear it. Perhaps your brother could help as well." the doctor turned to Dennis who nodded enthusiastically "Good man, you being siblings I wonder if you might be capable of similar feats."
Amy and Dennis smiled at each other then Karen, who nodded her approval.

"Crisis fucking averted" Karen said to herself. She was glad that the two of them would have something to enjoy together on a regular basis. At least she hoped it would be "So I suppose I'll have to arrange transport for you two whenever you need to be here."
"Thanks Karen." Dennis said "Although eventually I'd like to be able to drive one of those flying cars. Then I can get around without you needing to do everything for me."
"I said I'd teach you remember." Karen reminded him. "Well, I know we were planning on making a day of it but maybe we should head home. I think everyone could use a cooling off period."

Everyone nodded in agreement. Doctor Beckett walked with them as they left "Well look at that" he said amazed and pointed to the hole that the drones had made. Or at least where the hole had been. The drones had finished their repairs already and were sitting in standby mode, awaiting Amy's next orders.
"Jeez they work fast and that was just three of them." Dennis was impressed and excited. He couldn't wait to have a turn with them and hoped he was just as adept as Amy. He hated the idea that he might embarrass himself in front of everyone.

Amy walked over to her new mechanical pets "Good boys" she cooed and petted them "Go to sleep now. I'll see you three soon."
The drones obeyed and shut down. Amy turned and gave a thumbs up to the doctor who returned the gesture.
Before they left, Amy again apologized for the destruction she's caused but Doctor Beckett waved her off "All's well that ends well Amy. Amazing that your, uh, escapades here today may very well be the catalyst for huge advancements in not only robotics but cybernetics's to."

Dennis thanked the doctor for being so kind and understanding to his sister and for giving them both the opportunity to work with him. Karen expressed similar sentiments before they left the lab and headed to the car.
They'd left the bracelets in the hands of the doctor so he could analyze the signals that had passed through them during their visit.

The trio climbed into the car and Karen started it up. "Well that was interesting." she wiped her hand across her forehead.
"Sorry Karen. I shouldn't have been so pissed off at you." Amy said and hugged her from behind. Dennis took the passenger seat beside Karen.
"Honestly, yes you should be pissed off at us Amy." Karen held Amy's hand "It was unacceptable we put you through that. You had every right to know that such a drastic change was happening and I'm so sorry for not telling you."
Amy looked to Dennis next "Sorry you didn't get to play with the nanites bro."
He waved his hand "Its fine. It all worked out didn't it? Now we have an excuse to be around here a lot. They basically gave us both jobs so yeah. Just don't make a habit of wrecking everything."

"I know. Yesterday I wrecked the kitchen and now I've wrecked a lab." Amy sat back in her seat and winced.
"Not working on up are you Amy? Not planning on blowing up an entire city next?" Karen poked fun causing Amy to squirm.
"We might have a real life Doctor Doom on our hands if we aren't careful." Dennis joined in. Amy looked away and buried her face in her hands "Could you not"

"Wonder what the hell's gonna happen tomorrow. Second day here and its already gotten insane, is it always like this around here?" Dennis asked his girlfriend.
"No actually. Must be something to do with you two, you're having quite the effect on proceedings already. Who knows what you'll accomplish next." Karen laughed and started flying them home.

Amy finally looked from behind her hands and asked "So what shall we tell mom? I don't really want to speak to her right now. I don't want to risk getting angry again, I think I need to get away for a bit."
"You sure?" Dennis went and sat beside her "I mean if its what you want. Your friends are coming aren't they, maybe you could go stay with them. And don't worry I'll handle mom."

Amy put her head on her brothers shoulder "Thanks. Not sure I could handle our giant mom god right now. You still wanna meet my friends?"
"Yeah I do and I think I can handle whatever mom god throws my way. I know she feels she needs to walk on eggshells around me right now." Dennis exhaled "I hope she gets over that eventually, it'll get old real fast if she doesn't. All I want is for her to be my mom, if she can do that I'm good."

Karen looked in the rear view mirror at her boyfriend "Tell her how you feel. She'll understand if you do, it'll make things less awkward between you."
"Yeah you're right. Hey can we maybe go in the water when we get back. I'd like to start learning to swim." Dennis noticed his sister staring at him after his admission "I know its ridiculous.
"Not your fault, I didn't see any pools or anything where you lived so not like you could do anything about it." Amy gave him a warm smile, which Dennis appreciated.
"Still" she said and looked at him suspiciously "You sure you're not just trying to get Karen in a bikini?"

Karen laughed as she drove "Considering everything he saw last night of me I doubt me being in a bikini will make a difference."
Dennis turned away from both girls, unsure of how to respond. He wasn't used to being around so many women. Hooking up with someone and sleeping with them the first day he met them was not something that ever happened to him. Not to someone like him.

"Yet here I am" he smiled thoughtfully and saw Karen watching him. She gave him a wink then focused on the tunnel in front of her.

Amy looked between the two love birds and gave Dennis a goofy grin "Aren't you two so cute together."
Dennis scooted away and lay down across the large seat on the opposite side of her.

Karen heard Amy's comment "Well you're pretty cute yourself Amy. You know what I do to cute little things like you?" Amy knew what was coming. "I eat them up."

What neither Dennis or Amy knew was that Karen had, in her recent past, eaten people much poorer and smaller than her. She hoped to hell that they never found out about it, she knew it could have a devastating affect on her relationship with Dennis.
Karen felt her stomach rumble as she thought about eating tiny people, she didn't really feel any guilt over it, and would happily do it again if given the chance. As long as her boyfriend didn't find out of course.

Karen licked her lips "Need to find some people to shrink, people that no one will miss."
