152131111111111111111111111.title: Sink or swim

1521311111111111111111111111.content:
There was a knock at the door "Amy your friends are almost here."
Amy bolted upright "Shit" and ran to the door "Okay, I'll grab quick shower and be right out." She tore into the bathroom, jumped in her shower and began cleaning herself quickly.
After she was done she stumbled out and started blasting her long blond hair with a hairdryer "Come on dry faster." she growled in frustration "why didn't I wait till later to start playing with myself. I know Karen's hot but still... Mm Kar... no not now fuck sake." Amy grabbed her hairbrush next and went at it wildly "Don't think about Karen's fat sexy ass Amy."

Dennis could hear banging coming from Amy's room as he got ready to leave "The fuck is she doing in there?" He looked at Karen "Don't think she's still mad do you?"
Karen shook her head "Don't worry, she gets like this when she's in a rush." They heard a door slam and Amy came charging into the room "I'm here lets go now yes?" Dennis and Karen stared at her head "What?" Dennis tapped the right side of his head.
Amy reached up and pulled her brush from her hair "Oh."

Karen laughed and ran her hand down Amy's hair "You good now?"
Amy nodded and smiled "Ya lets go then." She made for the door "Hang on where are we meeting them? It better not involve going down that fucking thing from yesterday."
"It won't. We're meeting them in the city I showed you this morning." Karen said, taking Dennis's hand and leading him after her.
"We couldn't have come through that way?" Dennis asked "Sound's like it would have been quicker."
Karen looked at her boyfriend pouting "Not still mad at me are you?"
"No I'm not mad at you. Huh, out of curiosity what are they gonna do about that route in the future?" Dennis asked, kissing Karen's cheek.

Karen hadn't had time to deal with that issue yet "I'm not sure yet. Haven't had the time to deal with it since being here with you. Don't worry though you'll never be riding that thing again."
Amy yelled over her shoulder as they walked "Good, cause I ain't getting in it anyway. If I have to I'll have my drones build something better."
"You don't even know if they can build something like that yet" Dennis pointed out to his sister.
Karen joined in "Do you even know what knowledge those drones have? They might not carry anything related to elevators."

Amy thought for a moment "Well if they don't know yet I'll teach them how." "Do you even know how?" "Nope but I'm sure I'll figure it out."
Dennis and Karen stared at her in disbelief "She's very confident" Dennis whispered. "She gets it from your mom." Karen whispered back.

They reached the garage and for the second time today they hopped in Karen's car a took off. Amy was practically bouncing around in her seat as they approached the city and her friends. Dennis was less enthusiastic, he was nervous about meeting so many new people at once. People around his age.
Karen noticed how anxious he was "Hey it'll be fine. You just come in with us, meet her friends for a bit and then after that we can go home if you want." Dennis nodded and tried to relax.
Amy came up behind him "Yeah you'll be fine bro. Stick around as long as you want and I know you'll like them." Dennis looked at her "But will they like me? What if they see me as just some poor kid."
Amy gave him a look of confusion "Why would they? You're my brother. Besides, there aren't any rich or poor people anymore. After everyone moves in none of that will matter."

It took them fifteen minutes to reach the landing pad of a large pristine skyscraper and climb out of the car. "Okay so are they here yet?" Amy asked Karen.
"They should be here in a few moments. See there." Karen pointed at a large chopper approaching the building. Amy paced back and forth as they waited for it to land so she could finally see her friends.

Finally the vehicle touched down and the back opened. Amy saw fourteen figures descend the ramp and squeed as she ran towards them.
"Mel!" Amy flung herself into her best friends arms "I'm so glad you're okay. I'm so sorry about yesterday..."

"Hey, hey." Mel calmed her friend "It ain't your fault. You didn't know did you?" Amy shook her head and felt the rage well up inside her again but kept her composure in front of her friends "No I didn't know. No one bothered to tell me anything as usual."

Karen winced at the small amount of venom in Amy's voice.
Amy hugged each of her friends one by one until she shrieked "Nate?"
"Hey Amy" an olive skinned teenager said, embracing her.
"I thought I'd never see you again." Amy started crying. Mel moved beside them "He was in the area we were vacationing in and saw us when we were big. Once we shrunk he came over to us."
"What? Why didn't you come see us sooner if you saw us?" Amy demanded from him.
Nate sighed "I didn't want to upset you. I knew you'd have to leave eventually and didn't want you feeling guilty about what happened to me."

Nate was one of the friends Amy had lost over the years. His family had lost a lot of money and been shrunk, forcing them to move away.

"But we could have come see if we'd know where you were." Amy wasn't sure whether she should be angry with him or not "You're our friend no matter what size you are. Its bullshit you had to leave."
"Well don't look like that's gonna be an issue anymore" another friend, Kyle, an emo looking fellow, span around with his arms outstretched "This place is fucking awesome. You seriously didn't know bout this?" Kyle saw the look on Amy's face and shut up quickly "Oh right. sorry."

Dennis watched what was going on. He felt uncomfortable, like he was intruding into someone else's life. He froze as he heard Amy's voice.

"And this." She ran over to him and dragged him by his arm "Is my big brother. Dennis." Dennis managed an awkward "Hi."
Kyle was the first to greet him "Sup. Amy said she had a brother, you look so alike." He looked rapidly between them before being shoved aside "Quit freaking him out Kyle. Sorry about my boyfriend, I'm Mel."
"Hi. You're Amy's best friend then?" Dennis asked. Amy hung onto her brothers arm "Mel and me have been besties forever."
"Yeah, we've always been there for each other." Mel smiled at him. She had dark brown hair done up into a ponytail and hazel eyes.
"We wondered if we'd get to meet Amy's mysterious brother. When she said you were nearby and took off we thought she might bring you back with her."

Dennis chuckled "She did in a way. She was the one that convinced me to come here."
"Considering everything I was surprised you came in the end." Amy smiled at him "I'm glad you did. Not sure I would have managed without you here."
Dennis gave her a sly smile "Yeah Doctor Doom. Who knows what would have happened if I wasn't here." Amy glared daggers at him.
"Doctor Doom?" Nate asked "Did something happen Amy?"
"No. I mean yes. It doesn't matter though, Dennis helped me." Amy replied "I don't want to talk about it."

"Okay then. I'm sure you'll tell us eventually though." Mel held up her hands and grinned. She knew about Amy's explosive temper. She could guess that Amy being left in the dark about all this had caused her to go berserk and break something.
Amy began mingling among her other friends leaving Dennis with Mel, Kyle and Nate.

"Thanks for reining her in when I wasn't around." Mel whispered to him. "The hell did she break this time?"
Dennis raised an eyebrow "So this is a common occurrence then?" Mel made a maybe motion with her hand. "And regarding what she did, I'm not sure you'd believe me if I told you."
Kyle's face lit up "How bad was it this time? Did she trash another bathroom?" Mel elbowed him "Kyle shut it." She addressed Dennis again "I know Amy can lose her temper where your moms concerned, so I'm guessing it was way worse than usual" she motioned around her "with all this I mean."

Dennis kept his voice low "Yeah she's still pissed off even now. She's obviously angry no one bothered to tell her what was happening before hand and then seeing our mom grow..."
"Yeah, no offense that was fucking scary." Nate said.
"None taken. I was nervous to. I admit that ended up turning to anger quickly." Dennis admitted "When my mom requested I come almost blew it off. If Amy hadn't begged me I wouldn't have bothered."
"You grew up without them right?" Mel wasn't sure if she should be prying like this.

Dennis wasn't going to hide anything though "Mom took Amy and left when I was really young. I grew up with my dad. I didn't think my mom gave a shit about me till I met her yesterday, as it turns out things are more complicated than I thought they were." He shrugged at them.
"Did you know who your mom was growing up?" Nate asked him. Dennis nodded.

"I know it wasn't entirely my moms fault but I'm not letting her off that easily." Dennis stated "Although her walking around like I'll shatter if she touches me is pretty annoying." They gave him an inquisitive look.
"She's scared I'll get pissed off and leave if she makes a mistake." Dennis said.
1521311111111111111111111111.title: Old friends.

15213111111111111111111111111.content:
"Hard to imagine your mom being scared of anything." Mel said, studying Dennis "Is your temper as bad as Amy's or something?"
Dennis felt a little embarrassed "No, I don't think it is. I haven't started screaming or anything. I may have been unpleasant to Karen at first though. She didn't deserve that." He waved at his girlfriend who was talking with the helicopter pilot.

"I hope we're not bothering you with these questions." Nate said "We're complete strangers to you."
Dennis didn't mind "If Amy trusts you so will I. I'm assuming you know some things about my family anyway." They nodded.

"I never thought it would be me that's the less antagonistic sibling to our mom" Dennis glanced in Amy's direction "I think for now she'd rather stay with you guys than come back home. I think it will help her a lot if she's around all her friends."

"What about your mom?" Kyle asked "What if she want's Amy home with you?"
"I'll handle my mom. She's gonna have to be real careful how she handles Amy for now. I don't want them falling out after I just got here." Dennis knew he could deal with her. She'd listen to him if he told her to back off for now.
"Amy sometimes needs to cool off away from your mom." Mel explained "But I'm assuming you've figured that out."
"So are we living here now?" Kyle was looking around again. "If Amy's staying with us I'm guessing we're going somewhere after."

Dennis nodded at him "I think homes are being sorted for you guys and your family's. You know, if you want them."
"Homes?" Nate gasped "Here?"
"Its why this place was built from what I was told. It has dozens of other cities elsewhere inside to. Anyone who wants to can come live in this place, no matter how rich or poor they were out there."
Amy's friends were shocked "We don't have to worry about losing each other anymore?" Mel was tearing up and hugged Nate. Kyle smiled "See. I said this place was amazing. Will we be living close by to each other?"

Dennis shrugged "I don't know much to be honest. I would think so though, since Amy is so hell bent on keeping you all together. She wants to invite you to our place as well."
Mel laughed, she couldn't believe this was all happening "You're living with her? You're brave, very brave."
"Yeah i guess I am considering she smashed up our kitchen last night." Dennis laughed "And no that's not why I called her Doctor Doom."

"What exactly did she do then?" Kyle wanted to know so bad what Amy could have done.
Dennis put his finger to his lips "Maybe she can show you sometime. Or at least what she used to do what she did."
Her friends were even more curious now.

Amy meandered over to them "What are you four whispering about?"
They grinned to each other and Mel spoke first "We were just getting to know your brother that's all. I heard you'll be staying with us tonight then."
"If I can. Can I stay with you please, I need space from you know...." Amy pleaded with her best friend "I know it'll be your first night here..."
Mel held up her hand "Of course you can. I wouldn't turn you away when you need me babe."
"So when can we see our new homes?" Kyle asked "So exciting."

"I can help you with that Kyle." Karen joined them.
"Karen!" Mel hugged the older woman "You're so, so..."
"Small? I know, things have changed a lot in the last two days. I promise its only for the better though." the curvy redhead decided to grab everyone's attention "Alright guys lets get you some places to live, you've got whole new lives ahead of you here."

The small crowd whooped and clapped.

Dennis could see Amy's mood had lifted immensely since the incident in the lab. He thought it best if he let her be with her friends for now and go back home.
"You coming with us?" it was Nate.
"I think I'd just get in the way." Dennis shifted from side to side.
Kyle ambushed him next "If you're Amy's brother that makes you one of us. If you think it matters to us that you were poor dude, trust me it doesn't."
"You know how many friends we lost to that shit? To many. We'll never be separated again thanks to your mom." Nate said "The least we can do is be your friends to."

Amy stood back and smiled at Dennis. She'd told him her friends would like him and here they were proving her right.
15213111111111111111111111111.title: continued

152131111111111111111111111111.content:
Kyle whistled as he looked around their new home "Swanky."
Mel gave her boyfriend a dirty look "Did you really just use the word swanky? Also how much eye shadow did you use before we got here?"
"But I like it like this" Kyle said with a hurt expression on his face "I thought you liked to."

Amy was peeking in to various rooms around her friends house. Kyle and Mel would be living together while their family's got homes nearby.
"Hey don't break our nice new kitchen" Amy heard and whirled around to find Mel grinning at her. Amy scowled at her best friend "What did he tell you?"
"Who?" Mel leaned on a kitchen counter between them and laughed "Did someone tell me something about a kitchen being destroyed by a rampaging blond beast?"
Amy growled at Mel and gritted her teeth "I'm gonna kill him. Did he tell you anything else?"
Mel shook her head "Nope, he said you would show us or something. Not exactly sure what that means." She walked around and inspected the room. "Cool, all the cupboards, the fridge and freezer are full already." she said and rummaged through food in the freezer, pulling out a tub of ice cream.

Dennis was hanging around with Kyle and Nate. They stood in the houses large back garden and took in the view. The back of the house faced one of the large parks Dennis had seen earlier when Karen had flown them around the city. He could see a sparkling lake not far from them, tree's surrounded parts of it making the entire area serene. A footpath led from the back gate out into the park and forked off in different directions.

"I really get to live here..." Kyle was in awe as he turned his head back and forth, taking in the picture perfect scenery. Nate clapped him on the back "Its incredible ain't it. Looks like its got everything you could want out of a park." He thought for a moment and then pointed to a heavily wooded area in the distance "Think you could go camping in there?"
Dennis looked in the direction he was pointing "I don't see why not. Maybe that's why they put it all the way out there."
"I hope so" Nate said "Wonder how big the park actually is."
Kyle made for the back gate "Lets go see what that lakes like." Before he could open the gate a voice yelled "Not now Kyle, get your ass back in here and help me take our shit upstairs." Mel was standing at the back door beckoning him to her.

Kyle looked dejected "But most of our stuff is back at our old place. We don't have that much with us so why right now?." He quickly changed his tune when he saw the glare his girlfriend was giving him "Coming..."
"We're inviting everyone over for a party after remember." Mel smacked Kyle's ass as he went past her "So lets get this place ready."

Nate smiled and shook his head "These guys haven't changed at all."
"How long ago was it?" Dennis asked "If you don't mind me asking."
"A couple of years ago now. I remember everyone crying their eyes out when I got shrunk. We didn't know if we'd ever see each other again and yet.." Nate looked towards the house "now most of us are together again."
"There's more of you missing? We could easily help you find them." Dennis was starting to feel comfortable around Amy's friends now. They weren't like the other rich people who'd hurt him, they accepted him without a second thought. How could he not help them find the other friends they'd lost.

Nate wiped small tears from his eyes "Thank you. I'm glad Amy found you out there, you're a good guy Dennis."
Dennis felt like he was going to cry himself "We'll make sure none of you get separated ever again." "Guys get in here, we're ordering party stuff." Amy yelled from inside. "Doom demands our presence it seems."
The two guys laughed and headed back inside "I think I'll stick around after all." Dennis thought.

It was late afternoon when the rest of Amy's friends rejoined them at Mel and Kyle's place. Karen had found them all homes on the same street so they could be close by to each other and tomorrow their family's would be picked up and brought in as well.

Karen had her arm around Dennis's waist "So you're gonna hang around after all." Dennis nodded. "Good. They're a good bunch this lot, they'll help you fit in. It'll be as if you've always been one of them."
"You think a lot of them then?" Dennis asked. If Karen thought highly of them then they must really be something he thought.
"I've know these guys for a long time. Amy spent a lot of time with them growing up since you know.." Karen trailed off.
Dennis knew what Karen was getting at "Since mom wasn't around. They're basically been Amy's family then. If that's the case I should treat them like family to."

Karen was surprised by Dennis being so open to them all of a sudden. Earlier he'd been so hesitant to be here. "Really?"
He nodded "Its the least I can do since they've taken care of Amy so much. Oh and Nate said there are more friends they'd lost over the years. I'd like to find them all and bring them here."
"Well I'll have to help you with that. " Karen kissed her boyfriend and then held his face in her hands "I'm proud of you for doing this for them, I know Amy will appreciate it, more than you can imagine."
Dennis looked at the other guests, so many new faces, so many new.. friends. "They accepted me without question. I've never had any friends before so I'd like to do something to show my thanks."
They started walking towards the group of assembled party goers. "Well you do now cutey so get in there and join them."

Dennis sat with Nate in the back garden talking. Most of the group were in swimsuits hanging around the pool. "You're not going in?" Dennis asked his new friend. Nate shook his head and looked a little embarrassed "I uh, can't swim. I know its stupid."
"No its not." Dennis assured him quickly "Honestly I can't swim either. I actually just started learning earlier today."
"Just today? Who's teaching you?" Nate wondered.
"Karen is. She taught me how to float on my back first. I hope I can eventually go in the sea outside the back of our place."

"There's a sea outside your house?" It was Kyle. He yanked a chair out and sat down "You got a beachfront property or something?"
Dennis laughed at the emo's excitable attitude. Kyle's energetic personality was something that seemed to clash with his looks but then Dennis knew not to judge purely on appearance alone. He realized he liked Kyle a lot.

"There's a whole artificial beach and sea behind our home. Amy and I can go out there from our bedrooms." Dennis explained how his and Amy's apartment was set up as Kyle and Nate listened intently "I know Amy want's to invite everyone up eventually. Hell before this afternoons, uh, incident I'm sure she would have said to have the party there."
Nate grinned "Still not telling us what happened then? Was it that bad?"
"Pretty bad. It ended weirdly well though, me and Amy got jobs out of the whole thing" Dennis still couldn't wrap his head around all he'd seen and yet he was going to working up close with all that amazing technology.

"Jobs? What kind of jobs? Is it cool?" Kyle asked "Is that what you meant when you said Amy could show us?"
Dennis nodded "We got jobs in a robotics lab. Now I've said that I'm sure you have a rough picture of what might have happened."
Nate put his hand over his mouth laughing and looked over at Amy in the pool. "Are you saying Amy used a robot or something to destroy things?"
Dennis snickered "That about sums it up. It wasn't just one though, she used these three huge drones to rip half the lab apart. Her control over them was so good that the doctor in charge offered her and me the job of working with them."
Kyle burst into laughter "Holy shit, she wrecked a whole lab with drones?"
"Jesus Christ Amy" Nate shook his head in disbelief "I hope no one got hurt."

"No she didn't want to hurt anyone, she wanted to take out her anger on the stuff our mom had built. It seems everyone working here knew what was going on and didn't bother telling her." Dennis looked at his sister, she was so happy being reunited with her friends. All the problems of earlier in the day had faded from her mind. He was grateful that she wasn't hurting right now and instead enjoying herself like she should be. "This is the life you deserve Amy. One without all the baggage of our past weighing you down."
152131111111111111111111111111.title: Moving in party

1521311111111111111111111111111.content:
Karen was in the kitchen eating and watching the small crowd outside. The beautiful redhead had a smile on her face as she saw Dennis talking with Nate and Kyle "To think he wanted to leave before things got started." She knew if one group of people who could her boyfriend settle into his new life it would be this lot.
All of a sudden there was loud music blasting through the air, Karen had told them they could be as loud as they wanted tonight since there was no one else living in the street besides them yet. She's also acquired some booze for them since as far as she was concerned any laws that might have existed outside these walls didn't matter anymore. They certainly didn't apply in here "New world new rules. Better shield these guys from some of the more unpleasant shit that might happen though. None of them need that in their lives."

Kyle was stuffing as much cake into his mouth as he could. "So good." He said between mouthfuls.
"Kyle close your damn mouth when you eat" Mel yelled at him and dropped herself into his lap.
Dennis and Nate side eyed each other trying not to laugh as Kyle was accosted by his domineering girlfriend.
"Sorry boys." Mel apologized "he has no manners at all. Do you." She poked Kyle's chest then looked at Dennis "So I heard you were dating Karen."
Nate and Kyle's heads whipped around and stared at Dennis "Bullshit" Nate exclaimed "You shacked up with Karen?"
Kyle looked almost in awe of Dennis "Didn't you two just meet yesterday? How did you do it?"

Dennis laughed nervously and scratched the back of his head "I dunno, she came on to me. Which really surprised me after the way I acted towards her." He looked towards the kitchen window and saw Karen who waved at him.
He turned back and found his three new friends grinning at him "Someone looks like he's in love" Mel said causing Dennis to stammer "I..well..maybe I don't. I've never been in love before, I didn't even have any friends before today."

"I'm so sorry Dennis I didn't realize that." Mel put her hand on his and gave him a sympathetic look "I can't imagine what that must of been like for you."
Kyle slammed his fist onto the table "Well he's got us now. He's one of us." Nate joined in, affirming Kyle's statement "Damn right. No one should ever have to be alone like that."

"That's so sweet of you boys" Karen's voice came from behind them. She sauntered over and sat in a chair beside Dennis "What would we all do without all of you in our lives."
Nate raised his glass in a toast "I'm just glad I get to be you guys again so here's to us." The others raised their glasses with him and drank.
Kyle leaned across the table and addressed Karen "So I hear there's a place with robots here and that Amy and Dennis got jobs there."
Karen looked to her boyfriend then back to Kyle "I wondered how long it would be before you got wind of that. You want to get some of that action as well?" Kyle nodded enthusiastically.

Mel noticed a perplexed look on Dennis's face. "Can you believe this clown is a very talented engineer." she flicked Kyle's ear.
"I guess all our university stuff doesn't mean much anymore so..." Kyle shrugged "I would appreciate the opportunity Karen if you'll have me."
Karen smiled warmly at him "Of course Kyle, and if anyone else here needs help with further education, whatever that might be, I'm more than happy to help." She turned to Mel "Can you do me a favor and tell everyone tomorrow about discussing that with me?"
Mel gave her a thumbs up "Thanks Karen. We all owe you big time for all you've done for us."

They all spent the rest of the night partying hard. They had new homes, new lives and new futures. Kyle lent Dennis some spare swimming shorts after the group encouraged him to join them in the pool. It wasn't that deep so he had no issue getting in with them.
Amy hugged her brother tightly, he hadn't seen her this happy since they first met. "I'm so glad you stuck around bro."
Dennis returned her hug "Me to. Thanks for everything." He wasn't sure whether to bring it up right now or not but decided her should "So you're definitely staying here tonight?"
Amy nodded, a more serious look crossed her face "What will you do if mom calls?"
"I will handle mom. You just chill here and enjoy yourself" he leaned his back against the side of the pool and slowly paddled with his legs, he was feeling more and more comfortable in the water now "I'll make sure she leaves you alone until you're ready to talk."

Amy was so grateful her brother was here to deal with their mom. She didn't need the aggro from her right now.

While the others were in the pool, Karen was chatting with Nate about locating the other friends the group had lost over the years. They knew it might take some time before they located everyone but Karen assured him they would find them all no matter what.
There was a buzzing inside Karen's ear. It was Miranda.
"What's wrong?" Nate asked, noticing Karen was distracted by something.
Karen tapped the side of her head "Guess who's calling. She's probably heard about what happened with Amy by now. Can you excuse me a moment."
"Sure." Nate said "I think Dennis said he'd help deal with things when it came up. Should I go get him for you."
Karen thought about whether she should bother him with this but knew he'd want to know about it "Could you? Thanks Nate, tell him I'll be in the kitchen."
Nate made his way over to the pool while Karen headed inside.

Karen once again felt the buzzing in her ear and answered "Hey Miranda. I take it this is about earlier."
"Where's Amy is she okay? Her phones switched off." came Miranda's slightly panicked voice.
"She's fine. Looks like she'll be staying with Kyle and Mel tonight, they arrived this afternoon. She was pretty upset, she feels like no one cared about her enough to let her know what was going on. She's right though, we should have told her, she shouldn't have had to find out the way she did."
Miranda hesitated for a moment "You're right, it was stupid to not let her know. Why do I keep fucking up things with her Karen? It starts to get better between us and then I ruin it again."

Dennis entered the kitchen "Is that mom?" he asked. Karen nodded and transferred the audio to her phone.
"Dennis is that you? I'm sorry for what happened, do you think you could persuade Amy to talk with me?" he heard his mothers voice, he could detect she was stressed out.
"I don't think its a good idea mom and if this kind of thing keeps happening I don't think sorry will cut it anymore. You really need to communicate better with her or she'll never want to see you." Dennis wondered if he was being overly harsh with her but decided it was the best way to drive the point home "You just got me back do want to lose her and be left with just one kid again."

There was a long silence. Dennis hoped he'd gotten though to her. He finally knew he had when he heard his mom crying on the other end "I'll make sure I talk with her more whenever she wants to. Tell her it doesn't matter what I'm doing, if she needs me I'll be right there. Okay?"
"Okay mom. As long as you don't leave her out of things I'm sure she'll be fine. I'll talk with her tomorrow and see if I can get her to come talk with you. It might be best if you and Karen swap places again." Dennis said, he meant it when he said it would be better if his mom was in the room with them. He also wanted Karen to be a giantess again, his giantess goddess.

He heard a sniff as his mom regained her composure "Of course, if Karen's wiling to swap with me that is." Karen rolled her eyes and responded "Didn't I tell you I'd do it whenever you needed to? Of course I will, she needs her mom."
"Thank you Karen. I don't know what I'd do without you, and thank you honey, you've done so much for me already. Is there anything you want me to do?" Miranda asked her son.
Dennis knew what he wanted from her "Mom listen, I know you're worried you might upset me in some way if you say the wrong thing. Stop it. I don't need you treating me like some fragile vase that might shatter at any moment, just be my mom okay."
"Okay honey. I promise I'll try and be more relaxed from now on. As your mom though, I might end up being more firm with you, you ready for that?"
"Mom I'm 17 not 7."
"Still, until you're 18 you'd better behave yourself mister" Miranda laughed, taking Dennis's words to heart "You'd better do as your mom tells you. Got it?"
Dennis laughed "Yes mom. I'll do what I'm told."

"Hey guys I can't remember where the bathroom is." A clearly tipsy Kyle walked into the kitchen "Oh sorry am I interrupting something?"
Miranda heard his voice and said "Is that Kyle? Have you been drinking young man?"
"Oh shit. Hey Mrs Vaughn, I may have had a bit, but Karen said it was okay so..." Kyle froze in place as he heard Miranda's voice.
"Kyle do not call me Mrs Vaughn, it makes me feel old. And i suppose if Karen's say's Its okay then its okay."
"Okay God." Kyle giggled "And thanks for this awesome house, we all really appreciate what you're doing for us."
"Kyle call me Miranda and you are welcome, you guys have always been there for Amy... even when I wasn't. I'll always be grateful for that. Thank you sweetheart."
Kyle was shocked by Miranda's candidness "We'll always be there for her, uh, Miranda. No matter what and Dennis now he's here to."

Miranda felt like crying again "You're such a kind boy Kyle, my children are lucky to have you in their lives." Miranda decided to joke around with him a little "You know if you're really grateful, you could come worship me for a few hours a week. A nice handsome young man praising my divinity would be nice."

"Mom!" Dennis yelled. Karen and Kyle burst out laughing as Miranda tried to calm him "I'm joking honey. I don't think Mel would approve of me making moves on her man anyway."
1521311111111111111111111111111.title: continued

The palace collapsed around his waist and he bathed the world in shadow. With his god powers he felt the bugs at his feet had survived his growth spurt and transported them to the vast jungle of his pubes "Worship your god down there mortals, you can stay safe there as long as you serve me."

Mel and Kyle came together, trying not to scream to loud in case they woke anyone, before collapsing onto their bed. "Ooh fuck" Mel moaned "love your big cock babe."

Dennis and Karen were sleeping next to each other on the couch, a few of Amy's friends were passed out in chairs or on the floor.
Dennis was woken by the sound of the couple upstairs going at it and chuckled quietly. Karen stirred beside him "What's so funn... Oh" she could hear them now as well "Bet Amy regrets staying in one of the bedrooms now."

Mel's chest filled with pride as her giant boyfriend spoke about how he'd help Dennis walk again. Her boyfriend was a clown sometimes but it was moments like this that reminded her of why she loved him so much. "I'll have to reward him later" she thought and licked her lips "I'm gonna wrap myself around that massive cock of his and make him cum until he passes out from pleasure."

Amy ran forward as her brother exited the car and hugged him "We're gonna fix this bro I promise. Me and Kyle are going to see Doctor Beckett after and get started."
Dennis was a little confused "Start what?" he asked.
"We're gonna figure out how to fix your legs" Kyle beamed. This left Dennis stunned. Yet again Kyle wasn't hesitating to help him and his sister was to. He felt tears welling behind his eyes and began crying.

"What's wrong Dennis?" Amy asked and cuddled him. Dennis just about managed to speak above his blubbering "You're all doing so much for me. I don't feel like I've done anything to deserve your kindness, I... I just... I don't know what I could ever give you in return."
Amy groaned and ruffled his hair "You don't have to do anything. You're my brother, we're supposed to take care of each other."
Kyle knelt in front of Dennis and spoke next "Yeah that's what friends do for each other when one of us needs help."

This just caused Dennis to cry even harder as he was wheeled into their home. Once inside Karen went into the kitchen and picked up some energy drinks that had been delivered that morning.
She poured one into a glass and grabbed a straw before returning to the dining room and setting it on the table in front of Dennis.
"Drink up you. Better replace all the fluids you just lost." Her comment earned a laugh from him and he began drinking.

He thought about Amy and Kyle going to the lab later. He didn't know whether Karen would allow it but he wanted to ask anyway "Hey guys, you think I could come to the lab with you?"
The others looked at each other nervously, clearly afraid of upsetting him. To his surprise Karen agreed he could go "Alright I'll take you along but you're only going for a while so we can talk with Doctor Beckett about what can be done for you. After that we're coming straight home."
Dennis thanked Karen, the fact she was supporting him like that meant everything to him. She left to go make arrangements with the lab leaving the others to chat.

As he sat there talking with them, Dennis had a weird flashback to a dream he'd had while in his delirious state. When he looked at Kyle and Mel he remembered in his dream they had been giants and had brought him into their relationship, making him their little sex toy. He didn't remember the other two dreams he'd had. It was probably for the best he didn't remember being enslaved by his goddess mom and forced to live on her nipple.

The doctor looked at Karen who nodded. "Of course you're welcome to help us. Your current condition wont have any effects on your ability to control the drones." he patted Dennis on the shoulder and spoke to Amy next "I hope you're still joining us to."

"The hell was that all about?" Mel asked "Should they have been doing that?" Amy shrugged while Kyle walked over to the terminal to see what the drones had been trying to access. He didn't find much, they had been recalled before they had a real chance to do anything.
Still, he found it disconcerting they'd seemingly gone off on their own without any prompting from Amy. "The hell are they capable of?" he thought to himself "Are they usually able to act of their own volition?" He made a note to bring it up with Doctor Beckett later.

The trio eventually went back to join the others to discuss where they'd be starting with the research,
Once they left the room, three of the smaller drones detached from the main units and headed for separate terminals. They again plugged themselves in and began downloading information related to cybernetics and robotics. It was a major oversight on the part of the staff that the drones could even access the information in the first place let alone use it in some way. "They're mine like everyone else" Miranda moaned "They came from me, they belong with me, to me. I wont ever lose them."
She felt like it was a mothers dream to have absolute power over they're children. To protect them no matter what, even if they didn't agree with her.
They weren't adults yet so she could punish them if they misbehaved, if she had to shrink them down even further she could. She was their mom and as far as she was concerned, in her lust filled haze, that meant they had to obey her.

"Oh" she exclaimed "I should probably let him know about Dennis. I'll show him I'm better than he is, I wont do the kind of things he did."
She despised her ex but knew she should put aside her feelings for Dennis's sake.



Back at the lab Dennis was watching Charlie, one of the assistants, demonstrate a prosthetic leg. He wore a headband that allowed him to control it remotely, it was still very much in the early stages of development but Dennis was impressed all the same. Though he hoped it wouldn't get to the point he might need new legs.
"That" Doctor Beckett pointed at the headband "is built from the same technology as the bracelets you're all wearing. Although the headband is designed specifically to transmit brain signals unlike the bracelets more varied functions."

Kyle pondered Doctor Beckett's words. If the bracelets were capable of transmitting brain signals like the headband "Could that mean....?" he glanced at Amy. She was the one controlling the drones, maybe they weren't only responding to her vocal commands. "What if she's subconsciously directing them? If I knew what the drones were after..."
He wanted to keep his thoughts to himself for now, although he still would ask the doctor about the drones behavior. He didn't want to freak his friend out when she had so much on her plate already.

After the demonstration was over, Mel put her arms around Kyle's neck and whispered in his ear "You still up for tonight? I asked Karen for a favor..."

Dennis acquiesced, he was getting tired now anyway. The others were staying longer but they weren't going to start the real work until he could come help them.

1521311111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Miranda sat on her bed, phone in hand. She stared at the screen, at her ex's number "Fuck sake Miranda just get on with it." she said to herself and hit dial.
She furrowed her brow as the phone rang, she really didn't want to do this but knew it would be for the best.
The call was answered and a voice came over the phone "Hello?"
"Its me... Brian." Miranda spoke, hearing her ex's voice after so long, after everything that had happened. She wanted to scream at him, to tell him what a selfish bastard he was and she would never forgive him for what had transpired. Instead, Miranda kept her voice steady as Brian began talking.

"Oh... hello Miranda." he said, he sounded worn out to her "What can I do for you?"
"Look neither of us wants to speak and I'm only doing this for Dennis's sake." she said calmly "So just listen."
"Okay?" Brian could still recognize when she wanted to blow up at him, he surprised she wasn't screaming yet.
"Dennis ended up in the hospital, he ha...." she was interrupted just like she knew she'd be.
Brian was yelling now "What the fuck did you do? He's been with you five minutes and he's gotten hurt. I should never have let him go, I knew something would happen."

Miranda felt rage building inside her but still she kept herself from exploding "I didn't do anything. Dennis was in the hospital because he had heat stroke. He's currently in a wheelchair but otherwise he's fine."
"Fine? fine? how is my son being in a wheelchair fine?" Brian's voice was shrill "you wonder why I didn't want you near him, I knew this would end badly. I want you to send him home where he can be safe."
This time the blonde goddess couldn't control herself "safe? you think you can keep him safe you self righteous prick." she screamed "I saw the scars on his back, you call that keeping him safe? If he had been with me nothing like that would have ever happened. Unlike you I'd never intentionally hurt him."

Brian was nervous now. She knew about the attack on their son and wondered what else had been shared between them.
"Oh and just to tell you, he knows all about you keeping me from him and no I didn't go out of my way to bring it up." she was still screeching "I promised to answer any questions he had and that's exactly what I did. Unlike you I wont lie to him because I'm not as petty as you."

It was Brian's turn to start shouting again "I kept him away from you because you cared more about money. I didn't force you to walk out on us, you choose that."
"I wanted to give my children a better life. I didn't want them growing up in that shit hole of a town and yes I cared about money, why wouldn't I? At least I tried to better our situation instead of forcing my son to grow up friendless and alone." Miranda's fury just kept building. How dare he accuse her of not caring about Dennis, he was the one who made sure they were apart.

"Well guess what, he actually has friends now" the raging titan continued "people who will actually be there for him. It was one of those friends that saved our sons life. If something similar had happened when he was with you he'd be dead because no one would have been there to help him."
Brian didn't know how to respond to that one. She was right that Dennis didn't have friends growing up and the fact he did now made him glad. Brian hoped he'd be able to thank whoever had saved his child's life one day.
"Fine I get it we both fucked up" he lowered his voice to a normal level "So what exactly happened?"

Miranda breathed deeply, letting her rage subside "He was out on the beach behind his and Amy's new home, yes they have their own place now, and he must have been in the sun to long. He was in a delirious state and ended up going into the sea."
Brian's stomach dropped "He can't swim..."
"I am aware, he was in the process of learning from my assistant, the one you met the other week." Brian remembered the redheaded woman. "One of Amy's friends, Kyle, saw him drowning and dived in, saving his life. We both owe that boy a lot."
"I would like to thank this Kyle at some point." Brian was pale, the thought of losing his son filled him with dread. "Just make sure Dennis is okay. I can't stand the thought of that happening...."

"I know" Miranda whispered. An awkward silence hung in the air, neither of them wanted to talk about what had happened in the past. Of what they'd lost.
Miranda decided to be the bigger person, not like that was difficult for her, and made an offer "I could send someone to pick you up. You should at least come and see him."
Brian hated the idea of accepting anything from her but this was for his son. "Okay then. When can I expect the ride?"
"Tomorrow morning if that's acceptable. I'll tell him you're coming, I don't think springing any surprises on him in his condition would be a good idea." the goddess was far more relaxed now, she felt like a huge weight had been lifted from her shoulders.

Brian was worried about how his son would react to him after learning what he'd done "What if he says no?"
"I'll make him ready. He demanded I just be his mom so that's exactly what I'll do." "Miranda chuckled, this was something that would put her motherly skills to the test.
"I... thank you Miranda. You're clearly trying to put aside our differences for Dennis's sake, its only fair I do the same." Brian felt shame. The fact Miranda was only interested in acting in their sons best interest made him feel guilty. Maybe he'd been in the wrong all this time, maybe he'd misjudged her. But then there was the whole god thing to consider, he didn't really want to deal with that.

They talked for a while longer. Miranda told Brian about the lab and how they would work on fixing Dennis's nervous system and about his new friends being there to help.
Eventually they said their goodbyes and hung up. Miranda lay back and took some deep breaths "That wasn't as bad as I thought it would be."
She did take some satisfaction at being the one to extend an olive branch first. Getting under her ex's skin like that after the pain he'd caused her felt good. "Wonder how scared he'll be when he see's me up close. Bet he'll be calling me God in no time."
While she would act civil towards Brian in front of their children she was in no way forgiving him. If she could get away with it she'd probably eat him.
"I should have stomped in there while Dennis was to small to remember things properly and eaten that little shit. Then I could have kept my baby boy safe."

Miranda rubbed her stomach, imagining her ex screaming as she digested him alive. "If Dennis and Amy never want to see him again after he comes here, maybe I could go pay him a visit, no one would miss him. No one would think to check if he was gone."
A part of her hoped her children would reject their father. She wouldn't encourage such a thing, but she could hope all the same. She licked her lips "If they do you're taking a one way trip into my gut. They'll never know if they don't ask."

She moved her hand towards her pussy and began playing with herself. Miranda's sex drive had grown leaps and bounds with her gigantic body, she was almost insatiable these days, always wanting more.

She wouldn't have to rely on swapping places with Karen anymore, she could make herself as big or small as she wanted "I wonder how big I can get?"

Miranda imagined holding the planet in her hands. She was the mightiest being in existence, nothing could challenge her power.
Her family and worshiper's would look up at her in awe and reverence. They all loved their radiant, all powerful goddess. In time they would all beg to live inside the jewels around her glorious body, a wish she would grant them. 1521311111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"You did what?!" Amy yelled at her mother. Dennis sat in his wheelchair stony faced as he listened to Miranda explain what she'd done.
"I invited him here because he has every right to see how Dennis's is doing." Miranda said. She was sitting on the couch in their living room, Karen had swapped places with her tonight, and trying to calm her irate daughter.

Dennis finally choose to speak, he wondered if he should feel angry with her for not letting him know until after the fact. "Calm down Amy. Moms right, it wouldn't be right to keep him the dark." Amy fell silent. Dennis looked into his mothers shining green eyes as he talked to her "I get why you did it. You don't want to be like him and do what he did to you, you could have said something first though."

Miranda shifted in her seat, she hoped this wouldn't backfire on her "Well, I did what I felt was best for you, as your mom I have to act in your interest even if you don't necessarily like it. Your father is coming here tomorrow, once he's here it'll be up to you how you deal with it."

Dennis was actually impressed. His mom had clearly taken what he said to heart and was just being that, his mom. A small smile crept across his face "Okay I'll have to deal with it. I know this had to happen sooner or later so we might as well get it over with." He turned to Amy "Right?"
Amy nodded and sighed "Fine. But what happens after that? Is he staying around here or going back?"
"I'd rather stay out of this." Miranda said "This is between you three, but, whatever you two decide I'll support you." Miranda did not want her ex being able to accuse her of turning them against him. Anything that happened in the morning would be on his head and only his.

They spent a few more hours together before Miranda said goodnight and retook her place at the top of the world. She'd asked Karen if she'd done the right thing and felt relief when she agreed with her actions. As Miranda climbed into bed she felt a gnawing ache in her chest. Talking to her ex had brought up a lot of old feelings, nothing good, and she hated it. The loss she'd suffered when she was younger threatened to overwhelm her, it still hurt so much even though she'd tried to bury it deep inside.
Dennis nearly dying and talking to his father was a very painful reminder of losing her. Of losing Dennis's twin sister.

Miranda sobbed into her pillow and eventually fell asleep.


Dennis awoke, his body ached. He was still suffering from the effects of the heat stroke, he was told it would be quite a while before he fully recovered "That's if I fully recover" he thought, looking at his legs.
"Morning cutey" Karen greeted him warmly while carrying breakfast for him. Dennis smiled at his girlfriend. He knew she was still beating herself up over what had happened even though he didn't blame her at all.
One thing that was driving him crazy in all this was the lack of sex. He really wanted to be inside his goddess of a girlfriend right now, he would even love to be shrunk down again and shoved inside her thick ass.

Karen was aware of her boyfriends frustration but had insisted they wait until he recovered more before they resumed having sex. To ease him a little she promised to give him a blow job this weekend and depending how he was feeling after that, she'd sit on his face and let him eat her out.
"Aching again?" Karen asked and sat down next to him. Dennis nodded as she helped him begin eating. He'd been eating a lot of water melon in the past few days since it was fairly easy on his stomach and kept him hydrated.
"Not sure if you want to see your dad are you" Karen said as he ate. Dennis shrugged "Last week I wasn't sure if i wanted to see mom. Weird how that works, never thought it would be the other way around."

Karen kissed Dennis "You'll be fine. Just promise me you'll try and stay calm, I do not want you getting sick from stress. Okay?"
Dennis honestly didn't know if that would be a promise he could keep "I'll try but... I don't know if I can."


Two hours later Amy and Dennis sat in their living room waiting for Karen to return with their dad. The only reason Amy hadn't run off to Mel and Kyle's is because Dennis had asked her to stay with him.
They heard the front door open and glanced at each other. Dennis was gripping the arms of his wheelchair when his dad walked in "Hey kiddo" his dad said and moved towards him.
"Hey dad" Dennis responded, keeping his cool. He could see the concern on his dads face, he knew it must be hard to see him like this.

Amy stayed silent as their dad greeted her, only nodding in acknowledgment. "I'll leave you three alone." Karen said and went to the kitchen, giving Dennis a smile as she left.
Dennis turned to his father and slowly began to talk "I'll be fine eventually and just so we're clear, literally none of this is moms fault." He gestured to his legs, wanting to cut off that avenue of conversation immediately.

"I am aware its not her fault." Brian said "I hope in the future you'll be more careful, you're old enough to take responsibility for your own actions at this point."
Dennis chuckled at his dads candidness "I know I should have paid more attention to my surroundings." His tone turned more serious as he continued "So i take it you know what mom told me?"
Brian nodded, he'd been dreading this conversation "I know. I wont pretend I didn't do the things I did, I was only doing what I thought was best for you."
Amy looked ready to explode but a head shake from Dennis forced her down.

"I thought for years mom didn't want anything to do with me." Dennis spoke quietly "But I've seen all the letters she tried to send, the birthday cards. I read every single one of them. How exactly was lying to me for years doing what was best?" He failed to keep a small amount of venom from his voice "All those times I cried in bed wondering why she didn't love me. All the times she wanted to contact me and you were the one who got in the way."

"I thought I was protecting you..." Brian started. "Protecting me? from what?" Dennis spat "A better life? Friends? My sister?" he pointed at Amy "You made me think no one else loved me, why? so you could get back at mom for leaving? Did you hate her that much that you turned down help that could have made my life easier?"

His dad was silent. Brian had no real response to his sons accusations, he knew the more he pushed back against them the worse he would look. The fact was he had done those things.
"I know you were worried if mom was able to see me she'd take full custody" Dennis said, more calmly this time "and you know what? she admitted she would have, but she also said she wouldn't have cut you out of my life. She's never intentionally tried to hurt me."
Brian looked his son dead in the eye "Do you believe that? That she would have let either of you see me?"
"Yes. She hasn't lied to me since I've been here, not once. I know she's fucked up badly sometimes but she clearly wants whats best for me and Amy." Dennis glared at his dad, he truly believed his moms words.

Amy finally joined the conversation "You know what? I learned the only reason mom didn't tell me where you and Dennis were until now is because she was worried I'd stomp on in there and snatch Dennis up. She knew I'd never leave him in that place, and quite frankly she was right." Amy laughed "I was always so desperate to know who my dad and brother were, all that time I thought it was mom keeping us apart..."

"Do you hate me now?" Brian asked Amy. She just shrugged in response "No. Honestly I couldn't give a fuck at this point. You clearly didn't care enough about me while I was growing up so I don't feel the need to care about you." She got up and walked out of the room.

Dennis could see the tear in his dads eyes. "Is she wrong though?" he asked.
"I did care... but I was always so scared of losing you" Brian broke down.
Dennis raised his eyebrows as he thought about how his mom had said something similar "Mom had the same fears. The only reason she didn't try and take me is because she was scared you'd run off with me. She was afraid she'd never be able to see me again if we just disappeared."
Dennis felt pity at the sight of his father crying. Apparently his parents had a lot in common in the fear department. "Would you have run off? Just disappeared with me so mom couldn't find us?" he asked.

Brian simply shook his head "Honestly... I don't know what I would have done. Your mom was so much bigger than us, I can't see how far I would've gotten in that situation. I doubt there's any place I could have escaped her grasp if she wanted to find us and now...." He still hadn't seen her up close yet "now nobody in the world could escape her. Not now she's..."
"God?" Dennis laughed "I've seen how big mom really is now. But I'm not scared of her, hell, if anything she was scared of me until I got her to chill out."

Dennis pulled out his phone and began texting his mom "Hey mom why don't you show dad how powerful you are now."

"Really honey? You just want to use me to get back at him don't you? Alright here I come" she replied.

Dennis waved his hand towards the window.
Brian walked over to it and looked outside. A door opened on the other side of whatever room was out there and then she stepped through it. Miranda. Brian felt the urge to piss himself right there and then as his truly gigantic ex strolled towards them. A huge toothy grin on her face.
